titlestmt.titleproper: Rockefeller (Nelson A.) Gubernatorial records, Affirmative Action Files (N. Lee Cook), Series 8
A Guide to the Nelson A. Rockefeller Gubernatorial records, Affirmative Action (N. Lee Cook), Series 8 FA357

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2020-12-16 01:37:45 -0500.

did.unittitle: Nelson A. Rockefeller gubernatorial records, Affirmative Action (N. Lee Cook), Series 8

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Nelson A. Rockefeller served as governor of New York from January 1, 1959, to December 18, 1973. He was the first person elected to four consecutive four-year terms as a state governor.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use note
userestrict.p: Reproduction/duplication of archival items is routinely provided in accordance with "fair use." If the RAC does not hold copyright for an archival collection or items within a collection, it is the user's responsibility to contact the copyright holder, or make a fair effort to do so, prior to publication.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access note
accessrestrict.p: Brittle or damaged items are available at the discretion of RAC. Researchers interested in accessing digital media (floppy disks, CDs, DVDs, etc.) or audiovisual material (audio cassettes, VHS, etc.) in this collection must use an access surrogate. The original items may not be accessed because of preservation concerns. To request an access surrogate be made, or if you are unsure if there is an access surrogate, please contact an archivist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: NOTE TO RESEARCHERS

This series contains a portion of the office files of N. Lee Cook, a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. They document official activities in the execution of his duties as a member of Nelson A. Rockefeller's staff. The actions, decisions, and exchanges of information or points of view documented here occurred in the course of proposing and implementing policies for the Rockefeller administration, political campaigns, and/or Rockefeller's personal activities. However, unless a document is specifically addressed to or from Rockefeller, or is referred to in a document addressed to him, it should not be assumed he saw the document or was aware of its existence or substance. Furthermore, researchers should bear in mind that staff files may contain documents or drafts addressed to Rockefeller that were never shown to him.
SCOPE AND CONTENT

This small series contains a portion of the files of N. Lee Cook, who served as a Program Assistant for Governor Nelson A. Rockefeller. These files are specifically related to Affirmative Action Programs. The majority of the files contain significant documentation of the Affirmative Action Program of Greater Buffalo (BAAP) and the work undertaken by that organization in 1970 and 1971. Primarily, these files deal with construction issues and equal employment opportunities, as well as affirmative action concerns on construction sites around New York State.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action Program (AAP) - Three Basic Plan (Buffalo, New York City, Long Island)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: November 1970 copy of "Clarification and Specification of the Governor's Affirmative Action Program for Buffalo and Vicinity;" associated press releases and memoranda lifting construction moratorium in Buffalo after satisfying Equal Employment Opportunity issues; January 1971 Executive Order by NAR calling for Affirmative Action Training for Construction Projects in New York City.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Coordination

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: April/May memoranda on Affirmative Action Programs in New York State, implementation and adherence to guidelines.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - General
Affirmative Action - Out of State - California

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of "Affirmative Action Program in the Building and Construction Industry of California."

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - Chicago

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: "New York Times" article on problems with minority hiring in construction in Chicago area.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - Human Interest Regarding Employment (HIRE) (Buffalo)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Human Interest Regarding Employment (Buffalo Chapter) office on Affirmative Action problems in Buffalo area.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - Illinois

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of court judgement regarding Southern Illinois Builders Association v. Richard Ogilvie, Governor of Illinois. The judgement became known as the Madison/St. Clair Agreement and its implementation, the Ogilvie Plan.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - Lebron, Roberto

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence with Lebron, a member of the Administrative Committee of the Board of Urban Affairs Fund of the New York Building and Construction Industry, on various legal and affirmative action issues.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action - Out of State - Philadelphia

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of Congressional Record wherein the "Philadelphia Plan" was read into the record.

did.unittitle: Albany Plan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence on the "Pilot Program for Equal Employment Opportunity in Redevelopment Construction." an Affirmative Action program in the Capital District.

did.unittitle: Affirmative Action Program of Greater Buffalo (BAAP)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monthly accounts; correspondence and memoranda, clippings on Affirmative Action programs of Greater Buffalo, minutes of meetings, work of Buffalo Affirmative Action Task Force. Report.

scopecontent.p: Proposal for Affirmative Action program in central New York State region.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Department of Transportation - Bruckner Interchange

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and correspondence concerning alleged Affirmative Action violations on the Bronx construction project.

did.unittitle: Department of Transportation - Jamestown

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda and correspondence concerning alleged Affirmative Action violations on the Appalachian Regional Development Act project in the Buffalo area.

did.unittitle: Domed Stadium

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda on the building of a covered professional stadium in the Buffalo area.

did.unittitle: Governments, Agencies Conforming to March 2 Directive

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Letters and correspondence with various state agencies stating conformance with New York State Directive on Affirmative Action.

did.unittitle: Illinois

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Copy of court judgment regarding Southern Illinois Builders Association v. Richard Ogilvie, Governor of Illinois. The judgement became known as the Madison/St. Clair Agreement and its implementation, the Ogilvie Plan.

did.unittitle: Ithaca

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding training program in Ithaca-area trades.

did.unittitle: Long Island Plan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memoranda on minority employment in the construction industry in Long Island.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence regarding Affirmative Action adherence for State University at Stony Brook building construction.

did.unittitle: Mattina Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

did.unittitle: Minority Coalition (BUILD), Buffalo Plan

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda on the BUILD Affirmative Action Program in the Buffalo area. Reports on the progress of construction trade industry in implementing Affirmative Action.

did.unittitle: Niagara Falls

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Memo to the Governor on possible suit by Niagara Falls construction company over building of Niagara Falls Convention Center.

did.unittitle: Nixon Administration - Poor and Minority Equal Employment Opportunity

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence and memoranda, reports and clippings on Nixon Administration efforts to correct problems in poor and minority hiring in the United States.

did.unittitle: Union Jurisdictions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: List of the jurisdiction of construction trades in eight counties in the Buffalo area.
